intro: Microcephala lamellata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed microcephala, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. It is often found in mountainous areas and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
